info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MCDOWELL AND NORTHEASTERN RUTHERFORD COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Forest City, or 6 miles northwest of Polkville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sunshine and Thermal City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
